authors.name: Apoorva Prabhu
authors.affiliation: School of Chemistry and Molecular Biosciences, Australian Centre for Ecogenomics, The University of Queensland, QLD 4072, Australia

authors.name: Chris Rinke
authors.affiliation: Department of Microbiology, University of Innsbruck, 6020 Innsbruck, Austria

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"c97uj","text":"Water samples from estuaries are brackish to marine and in cases of many subtropical rivers, such as the Brisbane River in Queensland, Australia, have high sediment loads that pose a challenge for RNA fixation and extraction. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f372n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3h0il","text":"Here we provide a protocol that has been tested on water samples of the Brisbane River Estuary, in Queensland, Australia. The estuary has a high sediment load and pH ranging from 6 - 6.5 in the brackish zone. We optimized sample collection by using 3.6L of estuary water field fixed with 400ml of 5% phenol in ethanol solution. This protocol yielded 0.5 - 2ug of RNA with RIN value 7-9.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"3hppu","text":"DISCLAIMER – FOR INFORMATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY; USE AT YOUR OWN RISK","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cp5m2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"atvt6","text":"The protocol content here is for informational purposes only and does not constitute legal, medical, clinical, or safety advice, or otherwise; content added to protocols.io is not peer reviewed and may not have undergone a formal approval of any kind. Information presented in this protocol should not substitute for independent professional judgment, advice, diagnosis, or treatment. Any action you take or refrain from taking using or relying upon the information presented here is strictly at your own risk. You agree that neither the Company nor any of the authors, contributors, administrators, or anyone else associated with protocols.io, can be held responsible for your use of the information contained in or linked to this protocol or any of our Sites/Apps and Services.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":160,"length":12},{"key":1,"offset":631,"length":12}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"http://protocols.io"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"http://protocols.io"}}}}

status.info: This protocol has been used for a time-series experiment and confirmed as working.

steps.section: Sample processing in the laboratory
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e7hjf","text":"Use equipment such as filters, filtration towers and lines in the fume hood, for RNA purposes only. Wipe down all surfaces with 70% Ethanol, and use Alfoil (Aluminium foil) to cover working area (taped down). Use RNaseZap‱ RNase Decontamination Solution to wipe down all surfaces.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":218,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":221,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"B11F0CD376D011EF93C90A58A9FEAC02","name":":tm:"}}}}

steps.section: Sample processing in the laboratory
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c7pqg","text":"In the fume hood, set up a peristaltic pump (Masterflex, USA) with 18 gauge tubing connected to 24 inch tubing inserted into the phenol-fixed sample. The other end of the tubing is connected to 142 mm Merck Filtration Towers fitted with 8um pre-filters, and subsequently connected to 0.22um Sterivex filter. (SVGP1050H). Insert a tubing to the other end of the Sterivex filter and connect it to a drain sink. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare aqueous 5% phenol in 100% ethanol solution for sample fixation in fume hood
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"eb0j9","text":"Buffer Sigma Phenol from pH 4 to pH 6.9 using a pH meter and kit-supplied pH 10 concentrate.Around ~500ul of this concentrate is usually added to 60ml of 0.1M Citrate buffered phenol to reach pH 6.9 using a pH meter.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9p5of","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"44d3c","text":"Note : If this phenol is unavailable, an alternate can be prepared from 0.1M Citrate buffered phenol (Merck, USA) which includes a pH 10 concentrated solution. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare aqueous 5% phenol in 100% ethanol solution for sample fixation in fume hood
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8ao7l","text":"Prepare 400ml of 5% aqueous phenol in ethanol solution: Pour 380ml of 100% ethanol into a dark glass bottle (or bottle wrapped in aluminium foil), and pipette 20ml pH 6.9 phenol slowly along the sides of the bottle. Care should be taken to pipette in phenol from below the buffer layer. This is suitable for one sample collection (ie 3.6 L) of estuary water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Sample fixation in field
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4kmlj","text":"Pre-wash sample collection containers with 10% Hydrochloric acid followed by distilled water 3x times","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"60mlp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Sample fixation in field
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"408ij","text":"Using a sample collection bucket, pour upto pre-marked 3.6L line on the sample collection containers.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Sample fixation in field
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8ddq1","text":"Add 400ml of  5% aqueous phenol in ethanol solution carefully without spilling.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9erad","text":"Place bottle(s) into a large esky in the dark, filled with ice bricks to keep the solution cool during sampling","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Sample processing in the laboratory
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"onem","text":"Run the peristaltic pump (Masterflex, USA) at 100rpm watching carefully for leaks. This process should take around 20-30 mins. Ensure that all the water is dispensed from sterive without allowing it to dry, and keep the pressure under 30 psi.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Sample processing in the laboratory
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7hrli","text":"Plug the Sterivex filter using parafilm or sterivex caps, place them in Whirl-Pak Bags and snap-freeze in liquid N2.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":114,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Sampling equipment, reagents and kits required
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"50atn","text":"Reagents:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"94fu2","text":"Phenol - Sigma P4557 pH6.9","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bn4tu","text":"Ethanol","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"431dq","text":"10% Hydrochloric Acid","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7vujm","text":"10% SDS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9dql5","text":"Liquid N2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":8,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"75ao6","text":"RNaseZap‱ RNase Decontamination Solution - Thermofisher AM9780","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":5,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e2q31","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5dhm2","text":"Sampling equipment:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3hklj","text":"Acid-washed carboys/containers, pre-marked to 3.6L and 4L","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4gmua","text":"Sampling bucket","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e2b2b","text":"Merck filtration towers","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5fn88","text":"Merck 8um pre-filter 147mm","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9a3sn","text":"Merck 0.22um Sterivex filter - SVGP01050","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"12r3","text":"Parafilm","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"53o9f","text":"Whirlpak Bags","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"irnp","text":"Ice bricks","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5f137","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3mjbu","text":"Kits : ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dclju","text":"Purelink‱ RNA Mini Kit - Thermofisher 12183018A","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":8,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4kvpf","text":"TURBO DNA-free‱ Kit - AM1907","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":10,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":14,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9vc42","text":"2ml/1.5ml Eppendorf/RNase-free tubes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"9F2AEC7B76D011EF82230A58A9FEAC02","name":":tm:"}},"1":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"92830B75758711EF95440A58A9FEAC02","name":":tm:"}},"2":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"92830B75758711EF95440A58A9FEAC02","name":":tm:"}}}}

steps.section: Extract RNA using PureLink RNAqueous Mini-kit with modifications
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6r0j1","text":"Pre-heat the Elution buffer provided with the kit in heat blocks set to 72oC.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":74,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extract RNA using PureLink RNAqueous Mini-kit with modifications
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fsl35","text":"Defrost Sterviex within 1-2 minutes in the fume hood, and remove the parafilm/caps from one end. Keep the other end tightly sealed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extract RNA using PureLink RNAqueous Mini-kit with modifications
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8c082","text":"Add 900ul of lysis buffer provided with the kit and slowly add 100ul of 10% SDS along the sides of the sterivex filter.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extract RNA using PureLink RNAqueous Mini-kit with modifications
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"24ocm","text":"Place on a vortex shaker at maximum speed and shake for 15 minutes. After 15 minutes, rotate the sterivex filter 180 degrees and shake for another 15 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extract RNA using PureLink RNAqueous Mini-kit with modifications
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"comp4","text":"Extract the buffer + SDS mixture containing cells using a 3ml syringe. First, draw air into the syringe, attach to a luer-lock on the Sterivex filter, and slowly push air into the filter with minimal bubbling. Release the syringe, and in this process the buffer mixture flows into the syringe.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extract RNA using PureLink RNAqueous Mini-kit with modifications
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"gfpa","text":"Add the buffer + SDS Mixture into sterile 2ml tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extract RNA using PureLink RNAqueous Mini-kit with modifications
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9vho2","text":"Add equal volume of 100% Ethanol and mix well. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extract RNA using PureLink RNAqueous Mini-kit with modifications
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"94m2h","text":"Load 300ul of the buffer + SDS mixture into a spin column from the kit provided and spin at 16,000g for 15 seconds. Do not load more than this volume. You can load upto 2 times before dispensing the flow-through from the collection tube. Repeat this step until all of the buffer + SDS mixture is finished. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extract RNA using PureLink RNAqueous Mini-kit with modifications
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3jhdq","text":"Load 180ul of Wash Solution I onto the spin column and spin 15,000g for 15 seconds.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extract RNA using PureLink RNAqueous Mini-kit with modifications
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7vuq1","text":"Load 180ul of Wash Solution II/III onto the spin column and repeat spin.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extract RNA using PureLink RNAqueous Mini-kit with modifications
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a8bhv","text":"Load 180ul of Wash Solution II/III onto the spin column and repeat spin.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extract RNA using PureLink RNAqueous Mini-kit with modifications
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cij55","text":"Dry spin the spin column at 16,100 g for 1 minute, and replace the collection tube with 1.5ml eppendorf tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extract RNA using PureLink RNAqueous Mini-kit with modifications
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4h2eg","text":"Quickly add 11ul of pre-warmed Elution buffer to the centre of the spin column. Allow to stand for 1 minute at room temperature and spin at 15,000g for 30 seconds to elute RNA ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extract RNA using PureLink RNAqueous Mini-kit with modifications
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"160lj","text":"Repeat with a second addition of 11ul of pre-warmed Elution buffer and allow to stand for 1 minute at room temperature and spin at 15,000g for 30 seconds to elute RNA","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: DNAse treatment of eluted RNA samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e5hq7","text":"Add 2ul of 10X Turbo DNAse I buffer and 1ul of Turbo DNAse I to the sample along the sides of the tube. Mix gently using a vortex shaker and spin down.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Extract RNA using PureLink RNAqueous Mini-kit with modifications
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2vka1","text":"Discard the spin column and immediately place the RNA samples on ice rack.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: DNAse treatment of eluted RNA samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4mkp8","text":"Incubate in a shaking incubator for 40 minutes at 37oC. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":52,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: DNAse treatment of eluted RNA samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f21i3","text":"Add 2.3 ul of DNase Inactivation Reagent and mix thoroughly by vortexing. Incubate at room temperature for 2 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: DNAse treatment of eluted RNA samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8elaq","text":"Centrifuge the reaction mixture at 16,100g for 1 minute to pellet the DNase Inactivation Reagent. Repeat spin if needed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: DNAse treatment of eluted RNA samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8vqok","text":"Transfer the supernatent (approx. 20ul of RNA sample) into a fresh RNAse-free tube taking care to avoid the pellet. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: DNAse treatment of eluted RNA samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3n6jj","text":"Quantify using RNA tapestation or Qubit. The typical RNA yield is around 0.5 - 2ug, and RIN value is 7 - 9","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Sample processing in the laboratory
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3o0s0","text":"Place vortex mixer, centrifuge, and tube racks wiped down with 70% ethanol and RNaseZap‱ RNase Decontamination Solution onto the Alfoil area.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":84,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":87,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D2E5C22B76D011EF93C90A58A9FEAC02","name":":tm:"}}}}

title: Sample fixation and RNA extraction of brackish and marine samples with high sediment loads for metatranscriptomics sequencing
title_html: Sample fixation and RNA extraction of brackish and marine samples with high sediment loads for metatranscriptomics sequencing

versions.title: Sample fixation and RNA extraction of brackish and marine samples with high sediment loads for metatranscriptomics sequencing
versions.title_html: Sample fixation and RNA extraction of brackish and marine samples with high sediment loads for metatranscriptomics sequencing
